verses.kjv: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
verses.ct: I made a commitment with my eyes not to look lustfully at a young woman.

verses.kjv: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
verses.ct: What reward does God give from above? What does the Almighty hand down from on high?

verses.kjv: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?
verses.ct: Isn't ruin meant for the wicked? Isn't disaster reserved for those who do evil?

verses.kjv: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?
verses.ct: Doesn't he observe everything I do and keep track of every step I take?

verses.kjv: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;
verses.ct: If I have lived dishonestly, or if I have rushed toward deception—

verses.kjv: Let me be weighed in an even balance that God may know mine integrity.
verses.ct: then let God weigh me on an honest scale, and he will see my integrity.

verses.kjv: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;
verses.ct: If my feet have strayed from the right path, if my heart has chased after what my eyes desired, or if any stain has stuck to my hands—

verses.kjv: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.
verses.ct: then let me plant and someone else harvest the crop. Let everything I've grown be torn up by the roots.

verses.kjv: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour’s door;
verses.ct: If my heart has been seduced by another woman, or if I have lurked outside my neighbor's door—

verses.kjv: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.
verses.ct: then let my wife serve another man, and let other men sleep with her.

verses.kjv: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
verses.ct: Because that would be a shameful crime—a sin that deserves judgment in court.

verses.kjv: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.
verses.ct: It is a fire that burns until everything is destroyed, and it would wipe out everything I own.

verses.kjv: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;
verses.ct: If I have dismissed the complaints of my male or female servants when they brought a grievance against me—

verses.kjv: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
verses.ct: then what would I do when God confronts me? When he examines my life, how would I answer him?

verses.kjv: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?
verses.ct: Didn't the one who formed me in the womb also form them? Didn't the same God shape all of us before birth?

verses.kjv: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
verses.ct: If I have refused to give the poor what they needed, or let a widow's hope fade away,

verses.kjv: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;
verses.ct: or if I have eaten my food alone without sharing it with orphans—

verses.kjv: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb;)
verses.ct: (In fact, from my youth I raised the orphan like a father would, and from the time I was born I guided the widow.)

verses.kjv: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;
verses.ct: If I have watched anyone dying for lack of clothing, or seen a poor person with nothing to wear,

verses.kjv: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
verses.ct: and their body did not thank me for warmth, warmed by wool from my own sheep—

verses.kjv: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:
verses.ct: if I have raised my fist against an orphan because I knew the court would side with me—

verses.kjv: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.
verses.ct: then let my arm be ripped from my shoulder socket, let it be snapped off at the joint.

verses.kjv: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.
verses.ct: Because God's punishment terrified me; I could never stand against his majesty.

verses.kjv: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
verses.ct: If I have placed my trust in gold, or told pure gold, 'You are my security,'

verses.kjv: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;
verses.ct: if I celebrated because my wealth was enormous, because my own efforts had earned so much,

verses.kjv: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;
verses.ct: if I gazed at the sun in its brilliance or the moon moving across the sky in splendor,

verses.kjv: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:
verses.ct: and my heart was secretly drawn to worship them, or my hand touched my lips in reverence—

verses.kjv: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.
verses.ct: this too would be a sin deserving judgment, because I would have betrayed the God who is above.

verses.kjv: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:
verses.ct: If I took pleasure when my enemy was ruined, or celebrated when disaster struck him—

verses.kjv: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.
verses.ct: I never allowed my mouth to sin by calling down a curse on his life.

verses.kjv: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.
verses.ct: The people of my household always said, 'Everyone has had plenty of his food—no one goes away hungry.'

verses.kjv: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.
verses.ct: No stranger ever had to sleep in the street, because I always opened my doors to travelers.

verses.kjv: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:
verses.ct: If I have hidden my sins the way people do, concealing my guilt deep inside—

verses.kjv: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?
verses.ct: was it because I dreaded the crowd's opinion, or because the scorn of other families paralyzed me, so that I stayed silent and wouldn't go outside?

verses.kjv: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.
verses.ct: If only someone would listen to me! Here is my signature on everything I've said. Let the Almighty answer me! Let my accuser put his charges in writing.

verses.kjv: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.
verses.ct: I would carry that document on my shoulder and wear it on my head like a crown.

verses.kjv: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.
verses.ct: I would give him a full account of every step I've taken. I would approach him with confidence, like a ruler.

verses.kjv: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;
verses.ct: If my land has cried out against me, and its plowed rows have wept together,

verses.kjv: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:
verses.ct: if I have consumed its produce without paying, or worked its owners to death—

verses.kjv: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
verses.ct: then let thorns spring up instead of wheat, and weeds instead of barley. The words of Job are complete.
